Body: I'm using a PIC18F67J60 with the uIP (micro IP) stack to get online and communicate with a web server via Ethernet. However part of the process of finding the local IP of the device requires scanning the local network which seems to essentially DDoS the PIC offline; causing it to get hung somewhere and having to be reset by the watchdog. I haven't been able to find much online regarding this issue and I'm still troubleshooting it. Does anybody have experience with this or know a good place to start looking at a way of preventing this?

This is really too broad to be a valid question here.  Try modifying the code to print out scan results one by one on debug serial. Consider someone might have a wifi network with an SSID that breaks assumptions and causes a crash so if possible go somewhere remote or shielded.  Check the codebase repository for related known issues.
